title.narrative: 2.1.3: Community Led Total Sanitation (CLTS) APPROACH AND HYGIENE

description.narrative: By 2016, at least 60% of targeted villages get open defecation free status (ODF) and communities adopt good hygiene practices, particularly hand washing with soap., which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, in the provinces of the country showing poorest access and coverage of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services, at least 50% of the population accesses potable water and basic sanitation and implements good hygiene practices.

sector.narrative: Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, at least 60% of targeted villages get open defecation free status (ODF) and communities adopt good hygiene practices,particularly hand washing with soap.

description.narrative: 42% of targeted villages get open defecation free status. 207 villages with a population of 150,833 people were triggered for CLTS in MambXrX KadeX and Sangha MbaXrX. 21,000 people are living in the targeted ODF villages. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2018
